info.description:
[![](https://img.shields.io/pypi/pyversions/django-webpack-loader-db.svg?longCache=True)](https://pypi.org/project/django-webpack-loader-db/) #### Installation ```bash $ [sudo] pip install django-webpack-loader-db ``` #### Pros + no need rebuild docker image after webpack build with [webpack-bundle-tracker](https://github.com/owais/webpack-bundle-tracker) + compatible with [django-webpack-loader](https://github.com/owais/django-webpack-loader) settings #### `settings.py` ```python INSTALLED_APPS = [ "webpack_loader_db", ] WEBPACK_LOADER = {'DEFAULT':{ 'STATS_FILE': os.path.join(BASE_DIR, 'webpack-stats.prod.json') }} ``` #### Config + use [webpack-bundle-tracker `./webpack.config.js`](https://github.com/owais/webpack-bundle-tracker) + add `webpack-stats.*json` to `.gitignore`/exclude from docker image #### Models model|`__doc__` -|- `webpack_loader_db.models.Chunk` |Chunk(id, config_name, bundle_name, name, publicPath, path) #### Commands command|`help` -|- `python manage.py webpack_loader_db` |collect webpack stats #### Examples ```bash $ webpack --config webpack.config.prod.js $ python manage.py webpack_loader_db ``` ```html {% load render_bundle from webpack_loader_db %} {% render_bundle 'main' 'css' %} {% render_bundle 'main' 'js' %} ``` #### What's Next? separate dev/prod settings: `settings/dev.py` ```python INSTALLED_APPS+=['webpack_loader'] WEBPACK_LOADER = {'DEFAULT':{ 'STATS_FILE': os.path.join(BASE_DIR, 'webpack-stats.dev.json') }} TEMPLATES[0]['OPTIONS']['builtins']=['webpack_loader.templatetags.webpack_loader'] ``` `settings/prod.py` ```python INSTALLED_APPS+=['webpack_loader_db'] WEBPACK_LOADER = {'DEFAULT':{ 'STATS_FILE': os.path.join(BASE_DIR, 'webpack-stats.prod.json') }} TEMPLATES[0]['OPTIONS']['builtins']=['webpack_loader_db.templatetags.webpack_loader_db'] ``` #### Links + [django-webpack-loader](https://github.com/owais/django-webpack-loader) + [webpack-bundle-tracker](https://github.com/owais/webpack-bundle-tracker)

django-readme-generator
info.name: django-webpack-loader-db
info.html_description:
Installation

$ [sudo] pip install django-webpack-loader-db

Pros

  • no need rebuild docker image after webpack build with webpack-bundle-tracker
  • compatible with django-webpack-loader settings

settings.py

INSTALLED_APPS = [
    "webpack_loader_db",
]

WEBPACK_LOADER = {'DEFAULT':{
    'STATS_FILE': os.path.join(BASE_DIR, 'webpack-stats.prod.json')
}}

Config

  • use webpack-bundle-tracker ./webpack.config.js
  • add webpack-stats.*json to .gitignore/exclude from docker image

Models

model __doc__
webpack_loader_db.models.Chunk Chunk(id, config_name, bundle_name, name, publicPath, path)

Commands

command help
python manage.py webpack_loader_db collect webpack stats

Examples

$ webpack --config webpack.config.prod.js
$ python manage.py webpack_loader_db

{% load render_bundle from webpack_loader_db %}
{% render_bundle 'main' 'css' %}
{% render_bundle 'main' 'js' %}

What's Next?

separate dev/prod settings:

settings/dev.py

INSTALLED_APPS+=['webpack_loader']

WEBPACK_LOADER = {'DEFAULT':{
    'STATS_FILE': os.path.join(BASE_DIR, 'webpack-stats.dev.json')
}}
TEMPLATES[0]['OPTIONS']['builtins']=['webpack_loader.templatetags.webpack_loader']

settings/prod.py

INSTALLED_APPS+=['webpack_loader_db']

WEBPACK_LOADER = {'DEFAULT':{
    'STATS_FILE': os.path.join(BASE_DIR, 'webpack-stats.prod.json')
}}
TEMPLATES[0]['OPTIONS']['builtins']=['webpack_loader_db.templatetags.webpack_loader_db']

Links

  • django-webpack-loader
  • webpack-bundle-tracker
